page.title: 08VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Peppard has quite a number of shops,a post office,V.G. storesand another grocers shop. There is 1 cricket/football pitch used reguarly through the week. It also has a private school called Highlands School. The village hall called Peppard War Memorial Hall is used as a playgroup,polling station and other things. Bishops Wood special school is a school for mentally handicapped children. Peppard Common is an open space with a mixture of different types of trees. There is a steep slope ideal for sledging down in the winter. The wood opposite the Post Office is an ideal bird watching place. Peppard Common is ideal for picnicking in the summer with it's green grassy areas and is also good for walks. If you fancy a drink there are a few pubs near to the common
